intro: Adenocalymma grenadense, commonly known as the Grenada adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to the island of Grenada in the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
